shortcv.p: Mr. SPIROS BOROTIS was born in Athens, Greece, in 1976. He holds a B.Sc. in Mathematics from University of Patras (2000), and a M.Sc. in Information Systems from Athens University of Economics and Business (2002). From October 2002 he is a PhD Candidate in Athens University of Economics and Business. In 2001 he joined “ELTRUN – The e-Business Center”, and since then he worked as a researcher in projects funded by the General Secretariat for Research and Technology and the European Union. He also participated in the organization of the IFIP Conference “IS Perspectives and Challenges in the Context of Globalization” (Athens, June 2003), as the chief local organizing committee officer and overall responsible of proceedings’ editing. From March 2003, he works as the primary researcher of a project funded by Hellenic General Secretariat for Research and Technology, which focuses in the Analyzing of Training Needs in Knowledge Intensive Organizations, during the Adoption of KM and e-Learning Systems. His currente research interests focus in the identification of training needs, e-Learning strategies, Human Resource Development, and Information Systems.
